org.apache.juneau

Class Context

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.juneau.Context
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BeanContext, RestContext

    public abstract class Context
extends Object
    A reusable stateless thread-safe read-only configuration, typically used for creating one-time use Session objects.

    Contexts are created through the PropertyStore.getContext(Class) method.

    Subclasses MUST implement a constructor method that takes in a PropertyStore parameter. Besides that restriction, a context object can do anything you desire. However, it MUST be thread-safe and all fields should be declared final to prevent modification. It should NOT be used for storing temporary or state information.

    See Also:
    PropertyStore
